      • createMarginal

        public static IFactorTable createMarginal(int outputDomainIndex,
                          JointDiscreteDomain<?> inputDomain)
        Create a directed deterministic factor table that marginalizes out the specified subdomain of the joint input domain.

        Parameters:
        outputDomainIndex - a number in the range [0, inputDomain.getDimensions() - 1] that specifies which subdomain to produce as the first dimension and output.
        inputDomain - will be the second dimension in the table and the input.
        Since:
        0.05

      • product

        @Nullable
public static IFactorTable product(java.util.ArrayList<Tuple2<IFactorTable,int[]>> entries)
        Constructs a new factor table that is the product of all of the given tables.

        Invokes product(ArrayList, FactorTableRepresentation) with null representation argument.

      • product

        @Nullable
public static IFactorTable product(java.util.ArrayList<Tuple2<IFactorTable,int[]>> entries,
                            @Nullable
                            FactorTableRepresentation representation)
        Constructs a new factor table that is the product of all of the given tables.
        Parameters:
        entries - maps factor tables to an array of index mappings that indicates where each dimension in the table is located in the table to be constructed. Thus the index mapping array for a given factor table must have length equal to the factor table's dimensions and each entry must be in the range [0,N] where N is one less than the size of the new table. Every value from 0 to N must be represented in at least one index mapping array. N can be any number between the sum of the number of dimensions of all factors when the factors do not share any dimensions in common, or the number of dimensions of the largest factor. When two tables both map a dimension to the same dimension in the target table, the domains must match.

        representation - is the representation to use for the table to be constructed. If null, the representation will be set to either FactorTableRepresentation.DENSE_ENERGY or FactorTableRepresentation.SPARSE_ENERGY based on the density of the tables.

        Returns:
        Newly constructed table.

      • evalDeterministic

        public void evalDeterministic(Value[] arguments)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        Deterministically compute output arguments from input arguments.

        If table IFactorTableBase.isDeterministicDirected(), this method looks at the input arguments designated by the set bits of IFactorTableBase.getInputSet() and sets the remaining output arguments from them.

      • getEnergyForIndicesDense

        public final double getEnergyForIndicesDense(int... indices)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        Returns energy for given set of indices assuming that the table has a dense representation for energies. This provides the fastest possible lookup for energies.

        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.hasDenseEnergies(), IFactorTableBase.getEnergyForIndices(int...), IFactorTableBase.getWeightForIndicesDense(int...)

      • getEnergyForSparseIndex

        public final double getEnergyForSparseIndex(int sparseIndex)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        Returns energy of factor table entry at given sparseIndex.

        The energy is the same as the negative log of the weight for the same sparseIndex.

        Parameters:
        sparseIndex - should be value less than IFactorTableBase.sparseSize() specifying which table entry to access.
        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.getEnergyForIndices(int...), IFactorTableBase.getWeightForSparseIndex(int)

      • getWeightForJointIndex

        public final double getWeightForJointIndex(int jointIndex)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        Returns weight of factor table entry for given jointIndex.

        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.getEnergyForJointIndex(int)

      • getWeightForSparseIndex

        public final double getWeightForSparseIndex(int sparseIndex)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Returns weight of factor table entry at given sparseIndex.

        If necessary, this method will implicitly modify the representation to include a sparse form if it previously only held dense values; in this case, if the table only held dense energies, then sparse energies will be added, otherwise sparse weights will be added.

        Parameters:
        sparseIndex - should be value less than IFactorTableBase.sparseSize() specifying which table entry to access.
        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.getWeightForIndices(int...), IFactorTableBase.getEnergyForSparseIndex(int)

      • hasDenseRepresentation

        public final boolean hasDenseRepresentation()
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        True if either IFactorTableBase.hasDenseEnergies() or IFactorTableBase.hasDenseWeights() is true.

      • hasDenseEnergies

        public final boolean hasDenseEnergies()
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        True if underlying representation of table values includes an array of energies indexed by joint index.

        This is the optimal representation for methods that get/set energy by joint index or combined element indices.

        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.hasDenseWeights(), IFactorTableBase.hasSparseEnergies()

      • hasDenseWeights

        public final boolean hasDenseWeights()
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        True if underlying representation of table values includes an array of weights indexed by joint index.

        This is the optimal representation for methods that get/set weight by joint index or combined element indices.

        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.hasDenseEnergies(), IFactorTableBase.hasSparseWeights()

      • hasMaximumDensity

        public boolean hasMaximumDensity()
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        True if table has IFactorTableBase.density() is 1.0 and there are no zero weights.

      • hasSparseRepresentation

        public final boolean hasSparseRepresentation()
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        True if underlying representation contains a sparse representation of non-zero weights.

        True if IFactorTableBase.hasSparseEnergies(), IFactorTableBase.hasSparseWeights() or IFactorTableBase.isDeterministicDirected().

      • isConditional

        public final boolean isConditional()
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        True if table is in form appropriate for conditional distribution, i.e. if it is directed and the sum of the weights of entries for any given combination of input elements is a constant.

        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.isDirected(), IFactorTableBase.normalizeConditional()

      • isDeterministicDirected

        public boolean isDeterministicDirected()
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        True if table IFactorTableBase.isDirected() and has exactly one entry for each combination of input indices with a non-zero weight.
        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.evalDeterministic(Value[])

      • setEnergyForJointIndex

        public final void setEnergyForJointIndex(double energy,
                          int jointIndex)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Sets the table value indexed by the specified jointIndex to the given energy value.

        If the representation started out as deterministic (IFactorTable.hasDeterministicRepresentation()) and the energy changed, it will be implicitly converted to FactorTableRepresentation.DENSE_ENERGY and if FactorTableRepresentation.DETERMINISTIC_WITH_INDICES it will be converted to FactorTableRepresentation.ALL_ENERGY_WITH_INDICES.

        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.getEnergyForJointIndex(int jointIndex), IFactorTableBase.setEnergyForSparseIndex(double, int), IFactorTableBase.setWeightForJointIndex(double, int)

      • setEnergyForSparseIndex

        public void setEnergyForSparseIndex(double energy,
                           int sparseIndex)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Sets the table value indexed by the specified sparseIndex to the given energy value.

        If the representation started out as deterministic (IFactorTable.hasDeterministicRepresentation()) and the energy changed, it will be converted to sparse energies (retaining sparse indices if they exist).

        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.getEnergyForJointIndex(int jointIndex), IFactorTableBase.setEnergyForSparseIndex(double, int), IFactorTableBase.setWeightForJointIndex(double, int)

      • setWeightForJointIndex

        public void setWeightForJointIndex(double weight,
                          int jointIndex)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Sets the table value indexed by the specified jointIndex to the given energy value.

        If the representation started out as FactorTableRepresentation.DETERMINISTIC, it will be and the weight changed, it will be implicitly converted to FactorTableRepresentation.DENSE_WEIGHT and if FactorTableRepresentation.DETERMINISTIC_WITH_INDICES it will be converted to FactorTableRepresentation.ALL_WEIGHT_WITH_INDICES.

        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.getEnergyForJointIndex(int jointIndex), IFactorTableBase.setEnergyForSparseIndex(double, int), IFactorTableBase.setWeightForJointIndex(double, int)

      • setWeightForSparseIndex

        public void setWeightForSparseIndex(double weight,
                           int sparseIndex)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Sets the table value indexed by the specified sparseIndex to the given weight value.

        If the representation started out as deterministic (IFactorTable.hasDeterministicRepresentation()) and the weight changed, it will be converted to sparse weights (retaining sparse indices if they exist).

        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.getWeightForJointIndex(int jointIndex), IFactorTableBase.setWeightForSparseIndex(double, int), IFactorTableBase.setEnergyForJointIndex(double, int)

      • sparseIndexToIndices

        public int[] sparseIndexToIndices(int sparseIndex,
                         @Nullable
                         int[] indices)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        Computes domain indices corresponding to given sparse index.
        Specified by:
        sparseIndexToIndices in interface IFactorTableBase
        Overrides:
        sparseIndexToIndices in class FactorTableBase
        Parameters:
        sparseIndex - index in range [0,IFactorTableBase.sparseSize()).
        indices - if this is an array of length IFactorTableBase.getDimensions(), the computed values will be placed in this array, otherwise a new array will be allocated.
        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.sparseIndexToElements(int, Object[]), IFactorTableBase.sparseIndexFromIndices(int...)

      • sparseIndexToJointIndex

        public final int sparseIndexToJointIndex(int sparseIndex)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        Converts sparse index (one per table entry) to joint index (one per valid combination of domain indices).

        The sparse and joint index values should have the same ordering relationship, so that 

           sparse1 < sparse2
        implies that 
            t.sparseIndexToJointIndex(sparse1) < t.sparseIndexToJointIndex(sparse2)

        Returns:
        joint index in range [0,IFactorTableBase.jointSize()).
        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.sparseIndexFromJointIndex(int)

      • sparseIndexFromJointIndex

        public final int sparseIndexFromJointIndex(int jointIndex)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        Converts joint index (oner per valid combination of domain indices) to sparse index.

        Returns:
        if joint has a corresponding table entry its location is returned as a number in the range [0,IFactorTableBase.sparseSize()), otherwise it returns -1-location where location is the location where the entry would be if it were in the table.
        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.sparseIndexToJointIndex(int)

      • sparseSize

        public final int sparseSize()
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        The number of entries in the table that can be accessed by a sparse index. This can be no larger than IFactorTableBase.jointSize() and if smaller, indicates that the table has a sparse representation that does not include combinations with zero weight/infinite energy. The actual number of non-zero weight entries may be less than the sparse size.

      • compact

        public int compact()
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Removes entries from sparse representation of table that have zero weights.

        This may affect the IFactorTableBase.sparseSize() and the relationship between sparse and joint indexes.

        Returns:
        the number of sparse entries that were removed.

      • getEnergiesSparseUnsafe

        public final double[] getEnergiesSparseUnsafe()
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Returns the underlying array of sparse energies without copying for speed.

        IMPORTANT: modifying the contents of the array may put the factor table into an invalid state. This should be treated as a read-only value.

        If necessary, this method will implicitly modify the representation to include sparse energies (@link IFactorTableBase.hasSparseEnergies()).

        See Also:
        IFactorTable.getWeightsSparseUnsafe()

      • getEnergiesDenseUnsafe

        public double[] getEnergiesDenseUnsafe()
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Returns the underlying array of dense energies without copying for speed.

        IMPORTANT: modifying the contents of the array may put the factor table into an invalid state. This should be treated as a read-only value.

        If necessary, this method will implicitly modify the representation to include dense weights

      • getEnergySlice

        public final double[] getEnergySlice(@Nullable
                      double[] slice,
                      int sliceDimension,
                      int... indices)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Returns an array of energies for the sliceDimension of the factor table with all other dimensions fixed to provided values.
        Parameters:
        slice - if non-null and large enough to accommodate the values will be used as the return value, otherwise a new array will be allocated.
        sliceDimension - is an integer in the range [0, IFactorTableBase.getDimensions()-1] that identifies which domain the slice is for.
        indices - specifies the element indices that are to be fixed. The element index at position sliceDimension will be ignored.
        Returns:
        an array of energy values with size equal to the size of the sliceDimension of the table (i.e. getDomainIndexer().getDomainSize(sliceDimension)) holding the energy values from the table

        See Also:
        IFactorTable.getEnergySlice(int, int[]), IFactorTable.getWeightSlice(double[], int, int[])

      • getEnergySlice

        public final double[] getEnergySlice(@Nullable
                      double[] slice,
                      int sliceDimension,
                      Value... values)

      • getWeightSlice

        public final double[] getWeightSlice(@Nullable
                      double[] slice,
                      int sliceDimension,
                      int... indices)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Returns an array of weights for the sliceDimension of the factor table with all other dimensions fixed to provided values.
        Parameters:
        slice - if non-null and large enough to accommodate the values will be used as the return value, otherwise a new array will be allocated.
        sliceDimension - is an integer in the range [0, IFactorTableBase.getDimensions()-1] that identifies which domain the slice is for.
        indices - specifies the element indices that are to be fixed. The element index at position sliceDimension will be ignored.
        Returns:
        an array of weight values with size equal to the size of the sliceDimension of the table (i.e. getDomainIndexer().getDomainSize(sliceDimension)) holding the weight values from the table

        See Also:
        IFactorTable.getWeightSlice(int, int[]), IFactorTable.getEnergySlice(double[], int, int[])

      • getWeightSlice

        public final double[] getWeightSlice(@Nullable
                      double[] slice,
                      int sliceDimension,
                      Value... values)

      • getWeightsSparseUnsafe

        public final double[] getWeightsSparseUnsafe()
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Returns the underlying array of sparse weights without copying for speed.

        IMPORTANT: modifying the contents of the array may put the factor table into an invalid state. This should be treated as a read-only value.

        If necessary, this method will implicitly modify the representation to include sparse weights (@link IFactorTableBase.hasSparseEnergies()).

        See Also:
        IFactorTable.getEnergiesSparseUnsafe()

      • getWeightsDenseUnsafe

        public final double[] getWeightsDenseUnsafe()
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Returns the underlying array of dense weights without copying for speed.

        IMPORTANT: modifying the contents of the array may put the factor table into an invalid state. This should be treated as a read-only value.

        If necessary, this method will implicitly modify the representation to include dense weights

      • getIndicesSparseUnsafe

        public final int[][] getIndicesSparseUnsafe()
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Returns the underlying array of sparse element indices.

        IMPORTANT: modifying the contents of the array may put the factor table into an invalid state. This should be treated as a read-only value.

        If necessary, this method will implicitly modify the representation to include sparse indices (see IFactorTable.hasSparseIndices()) and if the table did not previously only had a dense value representation (see IFactorTableBase.hasDenseRepresentation()) it will implicitly add a sparse representation introducing sparse weights if the table had dense weights and otherwise introducing sparse energies.

      • hasDeterministicRepresentation

        public boolean hasDeterministicRepresentation()
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        True if table currently has a deterministic directed representation (either FactorTableRepresentation.DETERMINISTIC or FactorTableRepresentation.DETERMINISTIC_WITH_INDICES). Unlike invoking IFactorTableBase.isDeterministicDirected(), this will not check the values of the table or change the representation.

      • setEnergiesDense

        public void setEnergiesDense(double[] energies)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Sets representation to FactorTableRepresentation.DENSE_ENERGY with provided energies replacing the existing contents of the table.
        Parameters:
        energies - specifies the energies of the table in dense joint-index order. Must have length equal to IFactorTableBase.getDomainIndexer().getCardinality().

      • setWeightsDense

        public void setWeightsDense(double[] weights)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Sets representation to FactorTableRepresentation.DENSE_WEIGHT with provided weights replacing the existing contents of the table.
        Parameters:
        weights - specifies the weights of the table in dense joint-index order. Must have length equal to IFactorTableBase.getDomainIndexer().getCardinality().

      • setDeterministicOutputIndices

        public void setDeterministicOutputIndices(int[] outputIndices)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Sets representation to FactorTableRepresentation.DETERMINISTIC with given set of outputs.

        Parameters:
        outputIndices - any array mapping input indices, representing the joint value of all input values, to output indices, representing the joint value of all outputs. The length of the array must be equal to the value of JointDomainIndexer.getInputCardinality() on IFactorTableBase.getDomainIndexer().

      • setEnergiesSparse

        public void setEnergiesSparse(int[] jointIndices,
                     double[] energies)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Sets representation to FactorTableRepresentation.SPARSE_ENERGY with provided energies for each joint index.

        Parameters:
        jointIndices - are the joint indexes of the entries to put in the table.
        energies - specifies the energies of the table in the same order as jointIndices.
        See Also:
        IFactorTable.setEnergiesSparse(int[][], double[]), IFactorTable.setWeightsSparse(int[], double[])

      • setWeightsSparse

        public void setWeightsSparse(int[] jointIndices,
                    double[] weights)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Sets representation to FactorTableRepresentation.SPARSE_WEIGHT with provided weights for each joint index.

        Parameters:
        jointIndices - are the joint indexes of the entries to put in the table.
        weights - specifies the weights of the table in the same order as jointIndices.
        See Also:
        IFactorTable.setWeightsSparse(int[][], double[]), IFactorTable.setEnergiesSparse(int[], double[])

      • copy

        public FactorTable copy()

      • copy

        public void copy(IFactorTable that)

      • joinVariablesAndCreateNewTable

        public FactorTable joinVariablesAndCreateNewTable(int[] varIndices,
                                         int[] indexToJointIndex,
                                         DiscreteDomain[] allDomains,
                                         DiscreteDomain jointDomain)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Creates a new factor table that replaces two or more of its domains with a joint domain.

        Parameters:
        varIndices - contains the indices of the domains to be joined. Must have at least two entries in the range [0,IFactorTableBase.getDimensions()-1].
        indexToJointIndex - specifies the order in which the joined domains are to be incorporated into the new joint domain.
        allDomains - is the list of all domains before joining
        jointDomain - is the new joined domain. Its size must match the product of the sizes of the joined domains, and it is expected to be of type JointDiscreteDomain. It will be the last domain in the new table's domain list.
